page.title: 11Hill Farm,Barnardiston,
page.content: Hill farm and Frenches farm have been owned by the Horsley family for about 100 years.During recent alterations to Frenches farmhouse,Roman remains were found. Wheat,barley and oil-seed rape are grown and many modern machines are used for drilling,spraying and lifting.The harvest is a very busy time as the crops have to be dried and stored to keep them in top condition. Andrew Horsley is very conscious of conservation and has invested in a machine which ploughs the stubble back into the ground instead of farmers having to burn it,as has been the custum recently.He has also planted several small woods to replace dead elms and give cover for game birds. Mr.Horsley keeps a herd of Friesan cows and some Highland cattle.
